task: How to Paint a Motorcycle Tank
step: Remove all of the existing paint.
Cover all openings with duct tape, and use a utility knife to trim the tape before you paint a motorcycle tank.

Air brush and add designs, if desired.
Apply 3 to 4 coats of clear coat polymer.

task: How to Calculate Amount of Paint to Paint a Room
step: Read the labels on cans of paint carefully to see how much they cover.
Get roughly 1 US gal (3.8 L) for every 400 sq ft (37 m) if your walls are smooth.
Buy approximately 1 US gal (3.8 L) for every 250 sq ft (23 m) if your walls are rough.
Get twice as much paint if you’re covering a color or adding 2 coats.

task: How to Operate an HVLP Paint Sprayer
step: Mix the coating material to manufacturer’s instructions and strain material.
Fill the cup with the required amount of material.
Attach Cup Lid.
Turn fluid adjusting knob (18) clockwise to prevent fluid needle movement.
Turn spreader valve adjusting knob (23) counterclockwise to fully open.
Trigger the HVLP paint sprayer on and adjust inlet air pressure (for recommended figures see Chart 1 under Parts Replacement) at the gun inlet.
Turn the fluid adjusting knob counterclockwise until first thread shows.
Test spray.
If finish is too wet, reduce fluid flow by turning fluid adjusting knob (18) clockwise.
Hold the HVLP paint sprayer perpendicular to surface being sprayed.
Spray edges first.
Always turn off air supply and relieve pressure when gun is not in use.

task: How to Rag Paint a Wall
step: Prepare the room where you will be painting by removing all furniture (if possible) and other obstacles.
Cover the floor and any large furniture (like couches) that cannot be removed from the room with plastic drop cloths.
Tape edges of the areas you do not wish to be painted to protect the areas from paint splatters and brush edges.
Pour paint for the base color into a paint tray.
Mix the paint for the glaze that will be applied with a rag.
Roll the base color latex paint on the walls, covering the walls completely.
Apply the glaze paint with a rag.
Allow glaze paint to dry.
Wash out rollers and brushes, remove drop cloths, and return furniture to the newly rag-painted room.

task: How to Paint Large Areas
step: Wear long-sleeved clothing, gloves, and eye protection.
Use tarps to shield any exterior features you won’t want to get paint on.
Stir and strain your paint to make sure it has a uniform consistency.
Fill the chamber of your sprayer with the freshly-stirred paint.
Hold the nozzle of the sprayer 6–12 inches (15–30 cm) away from the surface.
Press and hold the trigger of the sprayer to begin applying the paint.
Spray the surface you’re painting in 1–2 ft (0.30–0.61 m) sections.
Let your paint dry for at least 1-2 hours before applying additional coats.

task: How to Paint Exterior Walls With a Paint Sprayer
step: Cover all plants, sidewalks, railings, and other sensitive surfaces around the wall with a tarp or a cloth.
Cover any windows and doors in or around the wall with tarps or sheeting.
Remove any elements that are not easily covered, such as protruding grates, screws, outlets, or switches.
Practice using a paint sprayer against a disposable surface such as a plank of wood.
Become familiar with the rate of spray, the ease with which the trigger moves, and the consistency of paint you desire.
Plan a path along which you will paint the wall.
Begin to spray paint with a steady stream.
Maintain a constant motion as you paint.
Take special care not to add additional paint to corners or other areas over which the sprayer passes constantly.
Finish the coat of paint at the bottom of the wall by keeping the paint sprayer a few inches (or several cm.).
Go over your first coat of paint again if you desire a more durable paint job or a deeper color.

task: How to Make Your Own Paint

Add the filler material to the paste.
Use the paint and store the excess in a sealed container.

task: How to Do Camo Spray Paint
step: Go to the store and get two different colors of flat or ultra-flat quick-dry spray paint.
Take the object that you would like to Spray Paint.
Spray paint one side with one color, let dry, and repeat on other side with the same color.
Find a leaf that is not rotted, ripped, or to big or small.
Place the leaf on your object.
Do little bursts of spray paint around the leaf.
Remove the leaf, place it somewhere else on your object, and repeat.
When you are done one side, let dry and do the same thing on the other side.
Finished.

task: How to Use a Paint Spray Machine
step: Choose the right spray paint machine for the project.
Get advice from your paint supplier about the kind of paint you need and whether you will need to thin it with water or paint thinner.
Select your nozzle, or tip, and pump pressure.
Practice on scrap pieces of wood or drywall.
Put down drop cloths and use tape and plastic sheeting to isolate the area you want to paint.
Wear coveralls, gloves, a hat, eye protection and a respirator to keep paint from settling on your clothes, hair and skin and to keep from getting paint in your eyes or in your lungs.
Adjust the viscosity of the paint, the pump pressure or the nozzle if the paint isn't going on evenly.

task: How to Paint a Ceiling
step: Repair damaged drywall before painting.
Roll on a single light coat of paint for textured ceilings.
Paint a vaulted ceiling from top to bottom.

task: How to Paint Plastic Models
step: Use spray paint to create uniform base coats before brush painting.
Work in a well-ventilated area, preferably outside.
Set your pieces out on a large sheet of paper or cardboard.
Use painter’s tape to cover any sections that you want to keep clear.
Shake your can and test the spray in the air or a scrap piece of paper.
Hold the can 10–12 in (25–30 cm) away from the pieces.
Spray in quick, smooth patterns across the surface of your model.
Wait at least 1 hour before you apply additional coats.
Wait 24 hours before brush painting or handling your model.
Use an airbrush to spray smaller areas of your model.

task: How to Paint Louvered Shutters
step: Apply water-based primer to wooden shutters with a 2 in (5.1 cm) paint brush.
Allow the primer to dry for 3 hours.
Paint wooden shutters with acrylic latex paint using a 2 in (5.1 cm) paint brush.
Apply plastic paint to plastic or vinyl shutters with a 2 in (5.1 cm) paint brush.
Open and close the louvers after you paint them if they are moveable.
Paint the other side of the shutters after 30 minutes.
Let the shutters dry overnight before you install them.

task: How to Paint over Existing Oil Paint in Your Home
step: Determine the type of paint previously used.
If the existing paint is lead-based, the local building codes in your area may require you to remove all existing paint before repainting.
If the existing paint is latex-based, you may simply paint right over it using latex paint.
If the existing paint is oil-based, you should first paint the room with one or two coats of a oil-based primer.
Allow the primer to dry for at least a day or two (see instructions on your particular paint), and then paint your top coat.

task: How to Paint a Computer Case
step: Open the side of your case.
Remove all expansion cards (PCI/AGP/PCI Express/etc), then remove your power cable from your motherboard.
Remove all screws from the motherboard and remove it from the case.
Remove the power supply.
Remove stickers, Velcro, etc.
Wipe down the case with a paper towel with rubbing alcohol on it.
After alcohol dries, spray an even coat over the entire case from 8–12 inches (20.3–30.5 cm) away.
Reassemble computer.

task: How to Paint by Number
step: Purchase a Paint-By-Number set.
Clear an area to work in.
Get a cup of water with which to clean your brush.
Read the directions on the box.
Check to see which colors correspond to which numbers.
Open the first paint container and paint every area marked with that number.
Wash your brush off when you finish to avoid accidentally mixing colors.
Let the areas you have painted dry.
Display your end masterpiece.

task: How to Spray Paint the Gears of War Symbol
step: Put a coat or 2 of primer on whatever you are spray painting on and let that dry for the amount stated on the can.

When the primer is completely dry, you can choose to either spray paint the background color, or the color of the picture, which ever you choose, put on as many coats as the can says, and let it dry for the amount of time stated on the can.
If you decided to spray the background color first, you will have to mask the entire area, and cut out the gear and skull shape.
If you spray painted the picture's color first, you mask the shape of the picture where you want it on your project.

Take the masking of, and if you are pleased with your work, spray a couple of coats of clear coat on the project(or how many stated on can) let it dry for the amount of time stated on the can, and you are finished.
But if you messed up something or you just don't like your results, you can just redo it by respray painting one of the colors, and starting from square one.
Now you can put your finished(hopefully) project somewhere in your house, hang it up in your room, do whatever you want with it.

task: How to Paint the Exterior of a Wooden Structure
step: Begin your preparation with a power washer.
For larger structures, scaffolding may be preferable to ladders.
Scrub all mold with bleach and water and water only, then rinse bleach.
Set all nails with nail set.
Screw all loose siding, trim and accessories.
Sand all loose paint.
When you sand loose paint, use a painters mask to avoid breathing fine paint dust.
To seal rusted nails drain pipes etc.
Break painted-in windows and repair window glaze by removing loose and patching.
Put paint into a 5 gallon (18.9 L) bucket with a roller screen, in combination with a hook, to hang it from ladders and scaffold, and as a catch if it should slip.
Do filling.
You must use paint over the entire exterior surface with exterior primer before you paint.
Choose paint.

task: How to Paint on Silk
step: Spray the silk with a diluted mix of water and rubbing alcohol.
Apply the first layer of paint while the silk is still wet.
Add a darker color next to add dimension.
Allow the item to dry for a few hours.
Build your lines or add designs with a dark color.
Create effects with alcohol or salt.
Set the paint with an iron after 24 hours.

Hang the hoodie up to dry to prevent cracking.

task: How to Paint Picture Frames
step: Select a latex or an oil based paint for a beautiful finish.
Apply a layer of primer to the frame so your paint will stick better.
Open the paint cans and gently stir the paint to mix it.
Put a small amount of paint on the frame and let it dry.
Brush the paint onto the frame in even strokes in the same direction.
Allow the paint to dry completely before adding a second coat (if needed).
Clean your brushes with the right solvent before putting them away.

task: How to Paint Warhammer 40,000
step: Assemble your models for the undercoat.
Once the undercoat is done, paint over your model, as completely as possible, with your chosen foundation colour.
Over top of your foundation(s) use your colour(s) to paint the main face of your model.
Use a Citadel wash/ink to get in the cracks of your models.
Go over any places you un-intentionally got the wash on.
Start your detailing work.
Clean up any part of the models that either weren't covered completely, or that got a bit of the wrong paint on them.
Make sure your model has no fault or anything.
You have finished your model and are ready to wage war across the galaxy!.

task: How to Paint Pine Cones
step: Choose an outdoor location for spray-painting.
Lay down newspaper to protect the floor or ground from spray paint.
Hold the spray paint canister upside down and shake it for 1 minute.
Test your spray paint on some scrap material to see how far away to hold it.
Apply thin coats of spray paint to the pine cones.
Dry the pine cones until you can’t smell the paint anymore.
Decorate your pine cones more if you’d like.

task: How to Protect Your Painting Supplies with the All in One Paint Bucket
step: Prior to work with the all in one arrangement, remove all the traditional painting tools from the working area.
Preferably on a workbench in the workshop, display all equipment, paint & tools, including the all in one arrangement bucket.
Unseal the all in one arrangement bucket hinged lid and flip it open.
Install the paintbrush inside the lid.
Install the paint roller onto the support inside.
Open the paint can you have already chosen at the paint store.
Consider seriously this step if you are to work a great deal on a ladder or stepladder.
Only after you are sure you will never need that paint again, there seems to be two ways to go.
Calculate the increased performance.

task: How to Protect Acrylic Paintings on Canvas
step: Dust your acrylic painting with a feather duster to keep it clean.
Avoid touching your painting with your fingers.
Keep your artwork away from bright sunlight.
Cover your painting in glass so it’s in a protective frame.
Keep your painting out of areas that are super dry or very humid.
Store your acrylic painting in a cool, dark place.
Bring your acrylic painting to a professional if you notice signs of aging.

step: Avoid using a sealer if you used paint formulated for latex.
Apply a gloss rubber cement sealer  for a shiny look.
Use a matte rubber cement sealer for a less shiny look.
Allow the sealer to dry for 12 hours.

task: How to Paint Fast
step: Paint around the edge of each wall with a paintbrush to create a border.
Use a roller to do a thin first coat that dries quickly.
Let the first coat dry completely for about 2 hours.
Add a second coat of paint to your wall with your roller for full coverage.
Touch up the edges of your walls with your paintbrush for a quick finish.
Remove the painter’s tape while the paint is still wet to avoid cracking.
Wrap your tools in plastic if you will be using them the next day.

task: How to Use a Heat Gun to Dry Paint
step: Make sure your work area is free of flammable materials.
Wear the proper safety gear while handling a heat gun.
Don’t place the heat gun nozzle directly against the surface you’re drying.
Avoid touching the nozzle or aiming the heat gun at yourself.
Turn the heat gun off before setting it down.

task: How to Paint on a Dress
step: Find a well-ventilated place to work in.
Cover a dress form with plastic wrap.
Put the dress on the dress form.
Mask off the areas you don't want to paint.
Choose a fabric spray paint, then shake it for 60 seconds.
Apply a light coat of paint to the dress.
Let the paint dry, then apply 1 to 2 more coats, if needed.
Remove the masking tape or stencils once the paint has dried.
Iron the dress to set the paint, if needed.
Read the dress's care tag and the paint's label for washing directions.

task: How to Paint with Glue
step: Place the plastic lid down on the workspace.
Pour the white glue across the lid.
Add color.
Add another drop or two of a different food coloring or liquid watercolor into another corner.
Continue adding the different colors until the whole glued area has been colored.
Use a toothpick to swirl the colors around nicely in the glue.
Set aside to dry.
Punch a hole into what is to be the top of the dried glue painting.
Hang the wet glue painting where it will catch the sun.

task: How to Paint Artwork for Your Walls
step: Decide on a "theme" for the painting.
Look at your wall and decide how large a painting you want on it.
Get a piece of paper and sketch your idea.
Go to any hobby or art supply store and buy a stretched canvas in your chosen size.
Pick up some acrylic paints in colors similar to the color theme in your room.
Spread some newspapers or a drop cloth under your canvas to protect your furniture.
Paint!.
Once you feel it's done-leave it alone!.
Hang your new artwork and enjoy the compliments from friends!.

task: How to Paint Wall Art for a Kid's Room
step: Find a photograph or picture that you want to display on your child's wall.
Create a digital copy of the picture.
Rent a projector.
Print the image onto transparency paper.
Position the projector so that it transfers the image onto your selected space.
Lightly trace the outline of the image using a blue pencil.
Turn the projector off.
Spread the paint you need onto a paint palette.
Carefully paint inside the lines using a paintbrush.
Let your paint dry for 24 hours after completing the mural.
Seal the mural with acrylic paint sealer.
Vacate the room until the sealer dries.

Note on the container when you opened the paint and where you used it.
Store the container in a cool, dry location out of the sun.

Wait 24 hours before painting over the new caulk.

Protect the floor with a drop cloth or tarp.
Mask the molding and baseboards with painter’s tape.
Create your own mist coat if you’d like to save money.
Purchase new plaster emulsion if you are short on time.
Prime the wall with a new plaster emulsion or mist coat.
Paint the edges of your walls.
Paint the rest of the wall.
Let the paint dry between coats.
Add a second coat as needed.
